hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bull Transition on Consecutive Accumulation Closes
hypothesis_content.statement: During a NEUTRAL regime, if BTC closes above its 20-day volume-weighted average price (VWAP) for 5 consecutive days, with each day's close in the top 60% of its daily range and declining exchange balances (≥ -5k BTC net outflow over the period), the regime is transitioning to BULL. A long entry on a pullback to the 20-day VWAP will be profitable.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Consecutive strong closes above VWAP indicate persistent buying pressure. Closing in the top of the daily range shows buyers are in control by session end. Concurrent exchange outflows suggest accumulation and withdrawal to cold storage, reducing immediate sell-side liquidity. This combination is a reliable precursor to a BULL regime as supply tightens and demand manifests.
entry_conditions: BTC closes above its 20-day VWAP for 5 consecutive days
For each of those 5 days: (Close - Low) / (High - Low) ≥ 0.6
Aggregate net exchange balance change (Glassnode) ≤ -5000 BTC over those 5 days
Enter long on the first daily close back below the 20-day VWAP after the 5-day streak

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price reaches a 1:2.5 risk-reward ratio (e.g., 2.5x the distance from entry to initial stop)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price closes below the low of the highest-volume day within the 5-day accumulation period

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 50% of such 5-day accumulation signals are followed by a price decline below the accumulation low (stop level) before achieving the 1:2.5 reward, indicating false breakouts or distribution disguised as accumulation.
